content.title: EVAR Surveillance
content.definition: CT at 1 month, 12 months, then annually. Consider duplex for low-risk patients. Lifelong follow-up essential.
content.statement: EVAR Surveillance is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Evar that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding EVAR Surveillance helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of EVAR Surveillance include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of EVAR Surveillance.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
